pageContext.claim: “We've been speaking to the Kurds, and they seem to be very satisfied. As you know, we've pulled back our troops quite a while ago, because I think it's time for us not to be worried about other people's borders.”
pageContext.analysis: It’s hard to imagine the Kurds are “very satisfied” with the drawback of U.S. troops. After the initial announcement, one Kurdish led group called the U.S. withdraw a “stab in the back.” Gen. Mazloum Kobani, commander of the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces, blamed any potential ethnic cleansing on the removal of U.S. forces.
